title: Did Donald Trump work at McDonald's? He references viral campaign stop
shortDescription: Trump spoke at McDonald's Impact Summit Nov. 17, 2025. He said he was the first former fry cook to be president. Did he work at the fast-food company?

title: Who is 'Bubba?' Not Bill Clinton, Jeffrey Epstein's brother says
shortDescription: Jeffrey Epstein's brother sought to dispel rumors that the 'Bubba' mentioned in a now viral email is not former President Bill Clinton.

title: 'Things happen': Trump dismisses Jamal Khashoggi's murder
shortDescription: President Donald Trump claimed Saudi Arabia's Crown Prince Mohammad bin Salman "knew nothing about" journalist Jamal Khashoggi's murder.

title: Trump defends Saudi crown prince
shortDescription: President Donald Trump defended the Saudi crown prince over a question on the slain journalist Jamal Khashoggi.

title: Court blocks Texas from using new GOP-friendly maps in 2026 midterms
shortDescription: The decision comes after a push from President Trump to revise Texas voters' district maps spurred other states to pursue mid-decade redistricting.

title: Watch live as House votes on releasing Epstein files
shortDescription: Congress is voting on a bill that would compel the Department of Justice to release as much information as legally possible on Jeffery Epstein.

title: Trump to outsource more Education Department functions
shortDescription: The department has worked out agreements with other agencies to outsource many of its functions elsewhere.

title: Jeffrey Epstein survivors speak out ahead of vote
shortDescription: Survivors of Jeffrey Epstein's abuse spoke on Capitol Hill ahead of a Congressional vote to release the files.

title: 'Quiet piggy!' Watch Trump admonish reporter over Epstein question
shortDescription: Trump was holding a gaggle Nov. 14, 2025, on Air Force One when a reporter was asking him about Epstein. Did he tell a female reporter “quiet piggy?”

title: Survivors rally as Congress weighs the Epstein Files Transparency Act
shortDescription: Congress is expected to vote on the Epstein Files Transparency Act. See abuse survivors and lawmakers gather ahead of the vote.

title: Trump tells reporter 'quiet, piggy'
shortDescription: President Donald Trump lashes out at reporter as Epstein emails spark tense exchange during press gaggle.

title: House expected to vote on release of Epstein files
shortDescription: The House of Representatives is expected to vote on a bill that would force the Justice Department to release all of its records on Jeffrey Epstein.

title: Trump says he's open to Mexico strikes
shortDescription: President Donald Trump said he would be "proud" to strike Mexico in an effort to combat drug operations.

title: Trump speaks at McDonald's forum
shortDescription: President Trump joked that he was the "first former McDonald's fry cook" to become president.

title: Trump gets a UN resolution for his Gaza plan. What it means.
shortDescription: The UN Security Council backed President Donald Trump's 20-point plan for Gaza. Here's what it means for the peace process.

title: Johnson says he'll vote for release of Epstein files. Live updates
shortDescription: The measure's fate is still uncertain in the Senate but early signs are it may have the votes to pass after Trump said he'd sign the bill into law.

title: Daily Briefing: House Epstein vote
shortDescription: Vote comes after Trump publicly endorsed the move. Here is the news to know on Tuesday.

title: NY Dems and GOP blast New York Power Authority over $7.5M plane
shortDescription: Top Democrats and Republicans in the New York Legislature think the NY Power Authority should stop flying execs across the state in a private plane.

title: Has Mamdani given Democrats their mojo back? | The Excerpt
shortDescription: New York City Mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani’s campaign centered on the issue of affordability. That resonated with young voters.

title: Special sauce: Trump leans on love of McDonald's to tout affordability
shortDescription: Trump sought to highlight his own attempts at reining in inflation and highlighting his love for McDonald's, a working class staple

title: House plans to vote Tuesday on releasing Epstein files. What to know.
shortDescription: The House is expected to vote on a measure on Nov. 18 that would force the Justice Department to release all of its records on Jeffrey Epstein.
